revisionDesc.change: Allowing the possibility to use corresp with lg to encodage Amandine stanzas
Completing Salome addition and creating a schematron rule for @type undertermined
Learning to add value in attributes and updating the schematron rules
Adding values for placeName - See Salome research
adding seg/@rend="check"
Updating the values for abbreviations
Changing the values for placeName
Working on contraints for dates
Working on the list of attributes for rs
Updating the model for placeName
Updating the model to encode person's names, addding provisional values for a list of types with roleName
Adding xhm and cja in @xml:lang
Changes the behaviour of g with @type
Adding some attributes and values for dates as well as for rs.
Correcting the error message for list element
Adding @unit="book" on citedRange
Adding a @type="feature" on space
Adding values for @unit with gap, adding a rule to allow the l element into lem if the encoder requires it more than one verse line
closing list attributes for unit with gap
adding @unit="section" with citedRange
Updating the encoding pattern for expan
Updating the constraints for children of head element
Adding the possibility to add a note inside a item, in the section commentary
Changing the @corresp on div, p, ab, lg, l and seg elements in favor of @rendition
Adding @unit="line" and @extent for space element
Adding the @corresp on div, p, ab, lg, l and seg elements
Adding the @part on element l
Updating the ODD to match the evolution of the EGD
Creating an ODD with legacy from the Epidoc Guidelines

body.p: DHARMA TEI Customization written by Daniel Balogh and Arlo Griffiths based on Epidoc schema.

moduleRef.except: addrLine address analytic biblScope biblStruct binaryObject cb distinct divGen emph gb headItem headLabel measureGrp media meeting mentioned postBox postCode relatedItem said soCalled sp street teiCorpus
argument back byline closer div1 div2 div3 div4 div5 div6 div7 front group imprimatur opener postscript salute signed titlePage titlePart trailer
addSpan damageSpan delSpan metamark mod path redo restore retrace secl substJoin transpose undo
c cl interp m pc phr s span spanGrp w
char charDecl charName charPop glyph glyphName localName localProp mapping unicodeName unicodeProp unihanProp value
alt altGrp anchor join joinGrp link linkGroup standOff timeline when
accMat acquisition additions adminInfo catchwords custEvent finalRubric heraldry locus locusGrp musicNotation recordHist rubric secFol stamp watermark

addName affiliation age birth bloc climate death education event faith genName geo geoFeat langKnowledge langKnown listEvent listNym listObject listOrg listRelation nameLink nationality nym occupation offset population relation relationGrp residence sex socecStatus terrain trait
lacunaEnd lacunaStart listWit rdgGroup wit witDetail witEnd witStart witness
cell figDesc figure formula notatedMusic row table
annotationBlock broadcast equipment incident kinesic pause recording recordingStmt scriptStmt shift transcriptionDesc u vocal writing
activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction locale partieDesc preparedness purpose setting settingDesc textDesc
case colloc def dictScrap entry entryFree etym form gen gram gramGrp hom hyph iType lang lbl mood number oRef orth pRef per pos pron re sense stress subc superEntry syll tns usg xr

valItem.desc: Jawi script - Narrower concept of Arabic Script

dataSpec.desc: reference to a member of the DHARMA project

valItem.desc: addition made within the original text (in textu)
addition in the top margin (in mg. sup. = in margine superiore)
addition in the bottom margin (in mg. inf. = in margine inferiore)
addition in the left margin (in mg. = in margine)
addition in the right margin (in mg. = in margine)
addition made in the space where a previous string of text has been erased (in ras. = in rasura)
when no information on the place is available
when the addition is marked in the witness with any non-alphanumeric mark (such as the cross-shaped called kākapada in Sanskrit)

sch:rule.sch:report: Divs other than @type=textpart may not nest in divs of different @type
At least two divs @type=textpart are expected in the edition
@resp and @source can not be used together

valItem.desc: written vertically from bottom to top, with the tops of characters facing left
written vertically from top to bottom, with the tops of characters facing right
written vertically from bottom to top, with the tops of characters facing upward
written vertically from top to bottom, with the tops of characters facing upward
written horizontally from right to left, with characters in their regular orientation
written horizontally from right to left, with characters mirrored around their vertical axis as in true boustrophedon
written horizontally from right to left, with the tops of characters facing downward
for a physically contiguous surface of a three-dimensional object of any shape and any number of sides
in texts where each line of a textpart continues across two or more surfaces such as the frontal and lateral face of a four-sided stele
for visually distinct zones on a single two-dimensional surface
for zones placed side by side and generally taller than they are wide (as in newspaper columns)
for physically distinct objects such as architectural elements, e.g. when an inscription is engraved on two pillars

to explicitly flag short, often unintelligible, pieces of text outside the campus of the main inscription and presumably not visible when the inscription was displayed in its original setting, which you judge to be trial engravings

sch:rule.sch:report: ex should only appear inside expan
ex should not be a child of abbr
expan should contain ex or abbr
gap may have @quantity (a figure) or @extent (a descriptive text value) but not both
If gap has @quantity then @unit is required
gap may not appear within supplied text
@precision can be use only with @quantity
The element gap with @reason='ellipsis' can only be used inside the apparatus or in translation.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The element gap with @quantity and @unit="line" expect either the use of @precision="low" or the element certainty.

elementSpec.desc: marks the start of each line of the transcribed text, including the first

valItem.desc: written vertically from bottom to top, with the tops of characters facing left
written vertically from top to bottom, with the tops of characters facing right
written vertically from bottom to top, with the tops of characters facing upward
written vertically from top to bottom, with the tops of characters facing upward
written horizontally from right to left, with characters in their regular orientation
written horizontally from right to left, with characters mirrored around their vertical axis as in true boustrophedon
written horizontally from right to left, with the tops of characters facing downward
Dated by the archaeolgical context, stratigraphy or associated finds
Dated by the material, iconographic or other physical context of the object itself
Text dated by nomenclature or onomastics
Text dated by an office or rank, e.g. the reign of an emperor or other ruler
Text dated by known persons named or implied within it
Dated via textual or linguistic context (other than explicit date or titles)
Dated by the use of official titles

sch:rule.sch:report: If space has @quantity then @unit is required

sch:assert.test: @type='binding-hole' or @type='descender' or @type='ascender' or @type='defect' or @type='feature' and @quantity and @unit

sch:rule.sch:assert: Space can't have @quantity and @unit attributes with @type='binding-hole|descender|ascender|defect|feature'.

valItem.desc: area that was left blank when the rest of the inscription was engraved, possibly with the intent to be filled later on
if the binding hole in a copper plate affects the text of a line
if a space was left blank in a line because (part of) another character hanging down from the previous line encroaches on the current line
if a space was left blank in a line because (part of) another (pre-conceived) character popping up from the following line encroaches on the current line
if the writing skips a blemish of the surface that was not deliberately created (such as a natural crack or pit, or a fault in the creation of the writing surface)

if the writing skips a deliberately created feature (other than binding holes, ascenders and descenders covered above) on the surface (such as engraved artwork, high relief, or a seal attached directly to a copper plate)
significant space that does not fit the other categories

elementSpec.desc: Character that cannot be identified unambiguously outside of its context. May contain character data and g only.

valItem.desc: for the initial part of a container (the end of which is lost or elsewhere)
for the medial part of a container (both the beginning and end of which are lost or elsewhere)
for the final part of a container (the beginning of which lost or elsewhere)

sch:report.test: count(child::tei:lem) eq 1 and not(child::tei:lem[@source]) and not(child::tei:rdg or child::tei:note)

sch:rule.sch:report: When the apparatus entry contains only a lem, the @source is mandatory

attDef.desc: how to display the bibliographic reference

valItem.desc: produces a bibliographic reference of the form “Allen 1923”
produces a bibliographic reference with just the date, of the form “1923”

sch:rule.sch:report: The pattern used in @match works with the element lg[@met]
The pattern used in @match works within the element gap

sch:rule.sch:assert: @match="../@met" and @locus="value" always work together.

attDef.desc: supplies the value of the date or time in the form yyyy-mm-dd.

sch:rule.sch:report: Note can not be used as a child of the element citedRange, only as a sibling of this element

valItem.desc: where a single-volume publication is divided into “books” within each of which a reference system is restarted
for a number in an anthology of editions, or an item in a numbered list
for a numbered (foot or end) note
to distinguish sections of publications where identical page numbers re-occur within a single volume (such as Epigraphia Carnatica)
for an entry in a dictionary or encyclopaedia
for one of many numbered paragraphs or short sections where this form of citation is practicable, such as many grammars (to be displayed as §, or §§ when the contents include a hyphen)

sch:rule.sch:assert: @notBefore-custom and @notAfter-custom must be used together
@notBefore and @notAfter must be used together

When using a custom attribute such as @when-custom or @notAfter-custom or @notBefore-custom, the attribute @datingMethod is mandatory and should declare the calendar used to convert the dates expressed in those previous attributes.
Only the year in a 4 digits format can be given for the vernacular calendar.

sch:rule.sch:report: The element fw must always be preceded by the element pb.

valItem.desc: written vertically from bottom to top, with the tops of characters facing left
written vertically from top to bottom, with the tops of characters facing right
written vertically from bottom to top, with the tops of characters facing upward
written vertically from top to bottom, with the tops of characters facing upward
written horizontally from right to left, with characters in their regular orientation
written horizontally from right to left, with characters mirrored around their vertical axis as in true boustrophedon
written horizontally from right to left, with the tops of characters facing downward

sch:rule.sch:assert: Foreign is the only element allowed as child of the element head
In a stanza identify as "mixed", the children verse lines must have at least an attribute @met or @real.
List can only be used inside a paragraph element.
ListApp can only be used inside the apparatus.

valItem.desc: for zones placed side by side and generally taller than they are wide (as in newspaper columns)
for a physically contiguous surface of a three-dimensional object of any shape and any number of sides
in texts where each line of a pagelike zone runs across two or more surfaces such as the frontal and lateral face of a four-sided stele
for physically distinct objects such as architectural elements, e.g. when an inscription is engraved on two pillars or doorjambs
for visually distinct zones on a single two-dimensional surface

sch:rule.sch:report: notes cannot nest

sch:report.test: not(ancestor::tei:div[@type='translation'] or ancestor::tei:div[@type='commentary'] or ancestor::tei:div[@type='apparatus'] or ancestor::tei:teiHeader or ancestor::tei:div[@type='bibliography'])

sch:rule.sch:report: Note is prohibited in div[@type='edition']
Inside div[@type='commentary'], note should be wrapped inside a p or an item element
Inside div[@type='apparatus'], note should be wrapped inside an app element. Please note that note(s) may not contain further notes.
Inside div[@type='bibliography'], note should be wrapped inside an p element for the epigraphic lemma
Note should the last element of the biliography
Note(s) be should the last element of the apparatus entry
Note(s) may not contain further notes (this is not a technical requirement but a convention we shall observe to reduce complication)
@value can not be used with the attributes of date range
@atLeast is expected with @atMost
@atMost is expected with @atLeast
@rend='stanza' can only be used in div[@type='translation'] and in div[@type='commentary']

sch:rule.sch:assert: @corresp can only be used with p in the context of a @rend="stanza" and inside a translatio

For @type="region", the @subtype should be one of the following values: @subtype='district' or @subtype='province' or @subtype='country' or @subtype='undetermined' or @subtype='land' or @subtype='island'

sch:assert.test: @subtype='garden' or @subtype='field' or @subtype='fieldPaddy' or @subtype='fieldMillet' or @subtype='orchard' or @subtype='orchardAreca' or @subtype='orchardCitrus' or @subtype='fieldIrrigated' or @subtype='fieldDry' or @subtype='fieldSalted' or @subtype='undetermined' or @subtype='nursery'
@subtype='tank' or @subtype='river' or @subtype='pond' or @subtype='canal' or @subtype='undetermined' or @subtype='wetland' or @sutype='pool' or @subtype='lake'
@subtype='forest' or @subtype='wood' or @subtype='grove' or @subtype='tree' or @subtype='mountain' or @subtype='undetermined' or @subtype='mount'

sch:rule.sch:assert: @subtype isn't allowed with @type='undetermined'

sch:rule.sch:report: The element p is not allowed in rdg
The element ab is not allowed in rdg
The element lg is not allowed in rdg
The element l is not allowed in rdg
@subtype requires @type='component' to be used
seg[@cert='low'] can be used only in div[@type='translation']
seg[@rend='pun'] only avaailable in div[@type='translation']
@rend='corrected' is only allowed when del is a child of subst

valItem.desc: combined application of vowel markers u and i to characters to be deleted
deletion marker other than strikeout and ui
the text to be replaced was neither erased, nor marked for cancellation (i.e. it is either overwritten with the post-correction text or left in place without any apparent alteration)

sch:rule.sch:report: The element p is not allowed in lem
The element ab is not allowed in lem
The element lg is not allowed in lem
Don't keep the l element in lem if you have only one of them

attDef.desc: may be used to specify further information about the entity referenced by this name
